article_title: Diet industry struggles as consumers eat more fresh food
article_text:
Thank you for your interest in licensing Fortune content. Please find information on various licensing contacts below and choose the one that best suits your needs:

1. To license Fortune articles, excerpts, or headlines for republication in various media (including books, eBooks, film, web, newsletters, newspapers, magazines and others), please email syndication@timeinc.com.

2. To license a Fortune cover, order reprint or e-print copies of an article or cover, or license an accolade, please contact PARS International at www.timeincreprints.com.

3. To license text only photocopies of Fortunearticles as print or digital handouts in academic settings, or in academic coursepacks, please contact the Copyright Clearance Center at www.copyright.com

twitter.description: To grasp the plight of the diet industry these days, consider these two statistics: 77% of Americans are actively trying to eat healthier, according to a poll conducted this month for Fortune by Su...
twitter.title: Lean times for the diet industry

article_metadata.keywords: diet foods, weight watchers, jenny craig, lean cuisine, healthy choice, obamacare, nutrisystem, medifast, frozen foods
article_metadata.description: Americans are eating better and perhaps exercising more. That's great news for the country—but not for the weight-loss industry.
article_metadata.sailthru.title: Lean times for the diet industry

article_metadata.sailthru.description: Consumers are eating more fresh food and perhaps exercising more. That's great news for the country—but not for the weight-loss industry.
